00018 /*
00019  * TopKList.h
00020  * A list that maintains top K records
00021  * Each record is assumed to be the
00022  * cnt_topic_t union. The abstraction
00023  * of the record is (word,cnt) pair
00024  * So top K records indicate K unique
00025  * records having the highest count
00026  *
00027  * The main assumption is that the
00028  * records inserted should be unique
00029  * wrt to the words. Same word with
00030  * different counts should not be
00031  * inserted. Results are undefined
00032  *
00033  *  Created on: 14 May, 2009
00034  *      
00035  */
00036 
00037 #ifndef TOPKLIST_H_
00038 #define TOPKLIST_H_
00039 #include "constants.h"
00040 #include <algorithm>
00041 #include "comparator.h"
00042 
00043 typedef cnt_topic_t cnt_word_t;
00044 
00045 class TopKList {
00046 public:
00047     TopKList(int K_);
00048     virtual ~TopKList();
00049     //Assumes that the words inserted are unique and doesn't check this explicitly
00050     void insert_word(const cnt_word_t& cnt_word);
00051     bool is_sorted();
00052     cnt_word_t get_max();
00053     typedef cnt_topic_t* iterator;
00054     iterator get_beg();
00055     iterator get_end();
00056     void print();
00057     void clear();
00058 
00059 private:
00060     int K, //The val K in top K
00061             num_elements; //The actual num of elements stored; can be lesser than K
00062 
00063     cnt_word_t* array; //The array which stores the elements. Its always kept sorted
00064 
00065     int32_t min; //The min count. Used to chk if an incoming element should be inserted
00066 
00067     void insert_into_array(const cnt_word_t& cnt_word);
00068 };
00069 
00070 #endif /* TOPKLIST_H_ */
